column2: (lying on a beach towel, recapping what happened in the last episode)\nOkay, so we went to the beach, because Phoebe found out about this lady who knew her mom\nand dad, and I don\xc2\x92t really know what happened with that.'
(to Phoebe) I\xc2\x92m your mother.'
Ehh?'
(voice-over) Oh, and then Monica joked that she wouldn\xc2\x92t go out with\na guy like Chandler...'
(to Monica) (in a funny voice) Hi there. (Monica turns her head away\nin disgust)'
(voice-over) ...and he couldn\xc2\x92t let it go, and... I don\xc2\x92t really\nknow what happened with that either. '

(voice-over) Oh-oh! And then Ross\xc2\x92s new girlfriend, Bonnie, shows up
and Rachel convinced her to save her head. And then Ross and Rachel kiss, and now Ross has
to choose between Rachel and the bald girl and I don\xc2\x92t know what happened there
either... '
Y'know what, hold on, let me go get Chandler. (gets up and leaves.)"
(surprised) Hi!'
Hi!'
Rachel was just helping me out. My head got all sunburned.'
Awww.'
(to Rachel) Thanks a million.'
Oh, you\xc2\x92re welcome a million.'
(getting up and leaving) (to Ross) Okay, I\xc2\x92ll see you in our room.'
Yeah. (closes the door, and goes over and kisses Rachel.)'
(softly) Oh my God.'
I know.'
(stopping suddenly and getting up) Okay, I gotta go.'
Whoa! What?! Why?!'
Well, I-I gotta go break up with Bonnie.'
Here?! Now?!'
Well, yeah. I can\xc2\x92t-I can\xc2\x92t stay here all night, and if I go in\nthere she\xc2\x92s-she\xc2\x92s gonna wanna... do stuff.'
Well, can\xc2\x92t you tell her that you are not in the mood?'
No, she likes that. Yeah. Faking sleep doesn\xc2\x92t work either, I\ncan\xc2\x92t tell you how many mornings I woke up with her...'
(interrupting) Whoa-ho.'
Whoa-oh, okay! Yeah, why am I telling you that?'
I don\xc2\x92t know.'
Yeah, yeah. (opens the door) It wasn\xc2\x92t every morning.'
Oh, making it worse!'
Okay.'
So I guess you\xc2\x92d like to know how it all happened. '
I-I mean I, well I think I can figure it out. I guess y'know I was born,\nand everyone started lying their asses off!"
Noo! No! It wasn\xc2\x92t like that I... Remember how I told you how\nLily, Frank, and I we were, we were close. Well, we were, we were very close.'
How close?'
Well, the-the three of us we were, kind of umm, a couple.'
I don\xc2\x92t even know how that would work!'
Well, we were...'
(interrupting) I\xc2\x92m not asking!'
Well, any how, some how I got pregnant, and, and I was scared. I was\nstupid and sellfish, and I was 18 years old. I mean, you remember what it\xc2\x92s like to\nbe eighteen years old?'
Yeah. Let\xc2\x92s see, my had Mom killed herself, and my Dad had run off,\nand I was living in a Gremlin with a guy named Cindy who talked to his hand.'

Well, I\xc2\x92m so sorry. I thought I was leaving you with the best
parents in the world, I didn\xc2\x92t even hear about your Mom and Dad til a couple of years
ago, and by then you were already grown up. I don\xc2\x92t know, you\xc2\x92re here, and I
would, I would really, I would like to get to know you.'

Yeah, well, everybody does! I\xc2\x92m a really cool person. And y'know\nyou had 29 years to find that out, but you didn\xc2\x92t even try! Y'know what, you walked\nout on me, and I\xc2\x92m just, I\xc2\x92m gonna do the same thing to you."
Wait!'
I don\xc2\x92t ever want to see you again! '
(walking back in with her hand over her eyes.) Umm, where\xc2\x92s my\npurse?'
(closing the fridge in disgust) Shoot! We\xc2\x92re out of soda.'
(jumping up) Oh, I\xc2\x92ll go out and get you some.'
Really?!'
Nope! Because I\xc2\x92m not your boyfriend. (to Phoebe, who\xc2\x92s\nentering) Hey Pheebs, how did it go?'
Well, umm, my Mom\xc2\x92s friend, Phoebe, is actually my birth Mom.'
I found a dried up seashores.'
Sweety, what are you talking about?'
Oh, my new Mom, who-who\xc2\x92s a big, fat abandoner! (starts to go\nupstairs)'
Whoa, wait, Pheebs, wait a second! Don\xc2\x92t you wanna stay here and talk\nabout it?'
No. I\xc2\x92m just, I wanna, I need to be alone.'
(turning around, insistently) Monica!'
Oh.'
It\xc2\x92s over.'
Oh, was it awful?'

Well, it was loong. I didn\xc2\x92t even realise how late it was, until I\nnoticed the 5 o\xc2\x92clock shadow on her head. (They both start to laugh, then stop\nthemselves quickly.) Anyway, she didn\xc2\x92t want to stay. I called a cab; she just left.'
I wrote you a letter.'
Ohh! Thank you! I like mail. (He goes to kiss her again, but she turns\naway.)'

(handing him the letter) It\xc2\x92s just some things I\xc2\x92ve been\nthinking about. Some things about us, and before we can even think about the two of us\ngetting back together, I just need to know how you feel about this stuff.'
Okay. (He leans in to kiss her again, but she leans back preventing him\nfrom making contact.) Wow, it\xc2\x92s-it\xc2\x92s 5
Well, I\xc2\x92ll be waiting for you, just come up when you\xc2\x92re done.'
Okay, I\xc2\x92ll be up in, (looks at the letter) 18 pages. Front and back.\nVery exciting.'
Oh. (looks at his watch) Oh-oh. (takes a drink of coffee and resumes\nreading the letter)'
(coming down the stairs) Hey! (Ross jumps up, and quickly puts the\nletter back together, pretending like he has just finished it.) What happened to you? Why\ndidn\xc2\x92t you come up?'
Done!'
You just finished?'
Well, I wanted to be thorough. I mean this-this is clearly very, very\nimportant to you, to us! And so I wanted to read every word carefully, twice!'
So umm, does it?'
I\xc2\x92m sorry.'
Does it?'
Does it? Does it? Yeah, I wanted to give that whole \xc2\x91Does it?\xc2\x92\npart just another glance.'
What are you talking about, Ross, you just said that you read it twice!\nLook, y'know what, either it does or it doesn\xc2\x92t, and if you have to even think\nabout it..."
(interrupting) No, Rach, no. I don\xc2\x92t, I don\xc2\x92t, I don\xc2\x92t have\nto think about it, in fact, I\xc2\x92ve decided, I\xc2\x92ve decided that, that it.......does.'
Are you sure?'
Oh, sure! I\xc2\x92m sure.'
I know. (Hugs him more violently this time and pushes him back away from\nthe letter.)'
All right, there\xc2\x92s a nuclear holocaust, I\xc2\x92m the last man on\nEarth. Would you go out with me?'
Ennnh.'
I\xc2\x92ve got canned goods.'
(jumping up in a hole that he is digging, he is shoulder deep) Hey, you\nguys! Take a look at this! (Chandler and Monica jump up and go over to the hole.) Check\nthis baby out, dug me a hole!'
Excellent hole, Joe.'
Oh no! No!! My hole!!'
(screaming in pain) Ow!! Ow!!!'
(climbing out of the hole) What?! What?!! What is it?!'
Jellyfish sting! Oh, it hurts! It hurts!! It hurts!!'
Well, can we help?! You want us to take you back to the house?!'
It\xc2\x92s like two miles!'
Yeah, and I\xc2\x92m a little tired from digging the hole.'
Oh damn the jellyfish. Damn all the jellyfish!'
We\xc2\x92ve got to do something!'
Well, there\xc2\x92s really only one thing you can do.'
What?! What is it?!'
You\xc2\x92re gonna have to pee on it.'
What?!! Gross!!'
Don\xc2\x92t blame me, I saw it on The Discovery Channel.'
Y'know what, he\xc2\x92s right. There\xc2\x92s something like uh, ammonia\nin that, that like kills the pain."
Well forget it! It doesn\xc2\x92t hurt that (tries to take a step) baaad!!!!'
If you want some privacy you can use my hole.'

Well, I\xc2\x92m ready to get the hell out of here! (Sees Ross and Rachel
cuddling on the couch.) Oh. Are you? Are you?!! (they nod \xc2\x91Yes.\xc2\x92) Ohh!
That\xc2\x92s so great!! Ooh, not for Bonnie. (they nod \xc2\x91No.\xc2\x92) But for you, yay!
Ohh.'
Hey!'
How was the beach?'
Nothing, I don\xc2\x92t know.'
What happened?'
Nothing. I\xc2\x92m gonna take a shower.'
Me too!!'
Me too.'
Okay, I\xc2\x92m gonna put this (her suitcase) in the car.'
Ooh, I have to go pack. (Gets up to do so.) It really does?'
It does. It really and truly does.'
(finding the part) (looks up in disgust) It so does not!!!'

She wants me to take responsibility for everything that went wrong
in our relationship. I mean she goes on for five pages about, about how I was unfaithful
to her! (Both Joey and Chandler shrug their shoulders as to say \xc2\x94Well...\xc2\x94)
(yelling) WE WERE ON A BREAK!!!!!'
Oh my God! If you say that one more time, I\xc2\x92m gonna break\nup with you!'

Fine! Fine! But this break-up was not all my fault, and she, she says
here, (reading from the letter) \xc2\x93If you accept full responsibility...\xc2\x94 (to
Chandler and Joey) Full responsibility! \xc2\x93...I can begin to trust you again. Does that
seem like something you can do. (yells at Joey) Does it?!!\xc2\x94'
No?'
Look, Ross, you have what you want, you\xc2\x92re back with Rachel. If\nyou bring this up now you\xc2\x92re gonna wreck the best thing that even happened to you.'
(calming down) Yeah, I know. I mean, no, you\xc2\x92re right. Yeah I guess\nI\xc2\x92ll let it go. But you-you understand how-how hard it is to forget about this.'
Sure, it\xc2\x92s hard to forget! But that doesn\xc2\x92t mean you have to\ntalk about it! A lot of things happened on that trip that we should never, (to Chandler)\never talk about.'
What the hell happened on that beach?!'
It\xc2\x92s between us and the sea, Ross!'
(to the person that answered the door) Hi, Ursula.'
Hey!'
Okay, well umm, I know that we haven\xc2\x92t talked in a long time, but\numm okay, our Mom is not our birth Mom. This-this other lady is our birth Mom.'
Right, okay, the one that lives in Montuak, umm-hmm.'
(shocked) You know her?!'
No, I umm, I read about her in Mom\xc2\x92s suicide note.'
There-there was a suicide note?! (Ursula nods \xc2\x91Yes.\xc2\x92) Well, do\nyou still have it?'
(disgusted) Hang on. (She goes into her apartment and slams the door in\nPhoebe\xc2\x92s face.)'
I can\xc2\x92t believe you didn\xc2\x92t tell me there was a suicide note!'
Yeah. So how have you been doing?'
I, umm, shut up!'
(reading from the note) \xc2\x93Good-bye Phoebe and Ursula. I\xc2\x92ll miss\nyou. P.S. Your Mom lives in Montauk.\xc2\x94 You just wrote this!'
Well, it\xc2\x92s pretty much the gist. Well, except for the poem. You\nread the poem, right?'
Noooo!!'
All right, hang on! (She takes the note, goes back into her apartment\nand slams the door shut.)'
Pass the cheese, please.'
My God, you can\xc2\x92t even look at me! Can you?'
Nope.'
(jumping up) Hey! Phoebe! We can talk to Phoebe!!'
No. I\xc2\x92m-I\xc2\x92m to depressed to talk.'
I\xc2\x92ll give you a thousand dollars to talk to us.'
(coming back in with Rachel) Hey, you guys! What do you, what do you think\nabout making that beach trip an annual thing?'
All right, that\xc2\x92s it, you guys! What happened out there?'
What? We took a walk, nothing happened. I can back with nothing all over\nme.'
Come on!'
What happened? Joey?'
All right. (gets up) '
(stopping him) No! Joey, we swore we\xc2\x92d never tell!'
(running over and joining Monica) They\xc2\x92ll never understand!'
Well, we have to say something! We have to get it out! It\xc2\x92s eating me\nalive!! Monica got stung by a jellyfish.'
(interrupting) All right!! All right. (walks slowly into the living\nroom) I got stung. Stung bad. I couldn\xc2\x92t stand. I-I couldn\xc2\x92t walk.'

(following Monica) We were two miles from the house. Scared and alone.\nWe didn\xc2\x92t think we could make it. (He goes to put his hands on Monica\xc2\x92s\nshoulders but for some reason can quite complete the action and pulls back.)'
I was in too much pain.'
And I was tired from digging the huge hole!'
And then Joey remembered something.'
I\xc2\x92d seen this thing on The Discovery Channel...'
Wait a minute! I saw that! On The Discovery Channel, yeah! About\njellyfish and how if you... (stops suddenly and turns to look at Monica) Ewwww!! You peed\non yourself?!'
Ewwww!!'
You can\xc2\x92t say that!! You-you don\xc2\x92t know!! I mean I thought I\nwas gonna pass out from the pain! Anyway I-I tried, but I-I couldn\xc2\x92t...bend that way.\nSo... (looks at Joey.)'
(turning to look at Joey) Ewwww!!'

That\xc2\x92s right I stepped up! She\xc2\x92s my friend and she needed help!
And if I had too, I\xc2\x92d pee on anyone of you! Only, uhh, I couldn\xc2\x92t. I got the
stage fright. I wanted to help, but there was too much pressure. So-so I uh, I turned to
Chandler.'
(wails loudly into his hands) Joey kept screaming at me, \xc2\x93Do it\nnow! Do it!! Do it! Do it now!!\xc2\x94 Sometimes late at night I can still here the\nscreaming.'
(laughs) That\xc2\x92s \xc2\x91cause sometimes I just do it through my wall to\nfreak you out.'

(singing) \xc2\x93...fuchsia and mauvvve. Those are the 66 colours of my
bedroommmm.\xc2\x94 (applause) Thank you, thank you. Ohh, and I invite you to count the
colours in your bedroom. (Sees that Phoebe Sr. has entered, and to her) Except for you.
You go away.'
I\xc2\x92ll go in a second, I-I just wanted to tell you that there\nhasn\xc2\x92t been a day where I didn\xc2\x92t regret giving you up.'
Okay, bye.'

No, I\xc2\x92m not done. I-I-I just want you to know that I, the
reason I didn\xc2\x92t look you up was, well I was afraid that you\xc2\x92d react, just well
like, the way, the way you\xc2\x92re reacting right now, and can\xc2\x92t we just, y'know,
start from here?"
No.'
Sorry. But just one last thing. Y'know you came looking for family.\nI\xc2\x92m family, I\xc2\x92m it. Now, now I\xc2\x92m done. (starts to leave)"
But, it\xc2\x92s not like we\xc2\x92re losing anything. Y'know?"
Yeah, I guess you\xc2\x92re right.'
It\xc2\x92s not like we-we know each other or anything. Or that have anything\nin common.'
Well, I don\xc2\x92t know. I mean it\xc2\x92s not like we don\xc2\x92t\nhave anything in common. I mean I like uh, pizza.'
I-I like pizza!'
You do?! Wait, I like umm, the Beetles.'
Oh my God, so do I!'
I knew it, wow!!'
Wait-wait-wait, wait! Puppies. Cute or ugly?'
Ohh, so cute.'
Uh-huh, well! But umm, still I\xc2\x92m-I\xc2\x92m mad at you.'
I know. I\xc2\x92m mad at me too.'
Well umm, do you wanna get something to eat? I\xc2\x92m kinda hungry.'
Hey! Me too!'
All right, stop it. Now you\xc2\x92re just doing it to freak me out.'
Oh-hooo, I missed you.'
I missed you too.'
Ooh, I was soo nervous about that letter. But the way you owned up to\neverything, it just showed me how much you\xc2\x92ve grown. Y'know?"
(getting miffed) I suppose.'
You have! Ross, you should give yourself credit. I mean my Mom never\nthought this would work out. It was all, \xc2\x93Once a cheater, always a cheater.\xc2\x94'
(getting angry) Umm-hmm.'
Ooh, I just wish we hadn\xc2\x92t lost those four months, but if time was\nwhat you needed just to gain a little perspective...'
(yelling from the bedroom) WE WERE ON A BREAK!!!!!!!'
(entering with Joey) (to Monica) Coffee house?'
You bet.'
And for the record, it took two people to break up this\nrelationship!!'
Yeah! You and that girl from that copy place, which yesterday you took\nfull responsibility for!!'
I didn\xc2\x92t know what I was taking full responsibility for! Okay?! I\ndidn\xc2\x92t finish the whole letter!'
What?!!'
I fell asleep!'
You fell asleep?!'
It was 5
Y'know I can\xc2\x92t believe I even thought about getting back\ntogether again! We are so over!!"
(starts to cry) FINE BY ME!! (he opens the door and traps Chandler behind\nit)'
Oh, oh, and hey-hey-hey, those little spelling tips will come in handy\nwhen you\xc2\x92re at home on Saturday nights playing Scrabble with Monica!!'
Hey!!'
(to Monica) Sorry!! (to Ross) I just feel bad about all that sleep\nyou\xc2\x92re gonna miss wishing you were with me!'
Oh, no-no-no don\xc2\x92t you worry about me falling asleep. I still have\nyour letter!!!'
And hey! Just so you know, it\xc2\x92s not that common! It doesn\xc2\x92t\nhappen to every guy! And it is a big deal!!'
I KNEW IT!!!!'
(sets down some cards) Gin.'
We were playing Gin? Y'know if we were a couple, we could play this\ngame naked."
Will you stop!'
Okay. All right.'
Okay, all right, I think you\xc2\x92re great, I think you\xc2\x92re sweet,\nand you\xc2\x92re smart, and I love you. But you will always be the guy who peed on me.'
